010package imagingbook.common.math;
011
012import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
013
014import java.io.ByteArrayOutputStream;
015import java.io.PrintStream;
016import java.util.Arrays;
017import java.util.Locale;
018
019import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.Array2DRowRealMatrix;
020import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.CholeskyDecomposition;
021import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.DecompositionSolver;
022import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.LUDecomposition;
023import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.MatrixUtils;
024import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.NonPositiveDefiniteMatrixException;
025import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealMatrix;
026import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealVector;
027import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.SingularMatrixException;
028
029import imagingbook.common.math.exception.DivideByZeroException;
030
031/**
032 * <p>
033 * This class defines a set of static methods for calculations with vectors and
034 * matrices using native Java arrays without any enclosing object structures.
035 * Matrices are simple two-dimensional arrays {@code A[r][c]}, where {@code r}
036 * is the (vertical) <strong>row</strong> index and {@code c} is the
037 * (horizontal) <strong>column</strong> index (as common in linear algebra).
038 * This means that matrices are really vectors of row vectors. Only arrays of
039 * type {@code float} and {@code double} are supported. All matrices are assumed
040 * to be rectangular (i.e., all rows are of equal length).
041 * </p>
042 * <p>
043 * Note: Methods named with a trailing '{@code D}' (e.g.,
044 * {@link #multiplyD(double, double[])}) operate destructively, i.e., modify one
045 * of the supplied arguments.
046 * </p>
047 * 
048 * @author WB
049 * @version 2022/08/29
050 */
051@SuppressWarnings("serial")
052public abstract class Matrix {
053        
054        private Matrix() {}
055        
056        /** Locale used for printing decimal numbers by {@code toString()} methods. */
057        public static Locale PrintLocale = Locale.US;
058        
059        /** Character used to separate successive vector and matrix elements by {@code toString()} methods. */
060        public static char SeparationChar = ',';
061        
062        /** Leading delimiter used for lists of vector and matrix elements by {@code toString()} methods. */
063        public static char LeftDelimitChar = '{';
064        
065        /** Trailing delimiter used for lists of vector and matrix elements by {@code toString()} methods. */
066        public static char RightDelimitChar = '}';
067        
068        // ----  Matrix creation -----------------------------
069        
070        /**
071         * <p>Creates and returns a {@code double[][]} matrix containing the specified values.
072         * Throws an {@link IllegalArgumentException} if the number of supplied values does
073         * not exactly match the matrix size. Example for creating a 2x3 matrix:
074         * </p>
075         * <pre>
076         * double[][] A = makeDoubleMatrix(2, 3, 
077         *              1.0, 2.0, 3.0,
078         *              4.0, 5.0, 6.0 );</pre>
079         * <p>
080         * See also {@link #flatten(double[][])}.
081         * </p>
082         * 
083         * @param rows the number of matrix rows
084         * @param cols the number of matrix columns
085         * @param values a sequence of matrix values in row-major order (may also be passed as a {@code double[]})
086         * @return a {@code double[][]} matrix
087         */
088        public static double[][] makeDoubleMatrix(final int rows, final int cols, final double... values) {
089                final double[][] A = new double[rows][cols];
090                if (values == null || values.length == 0) {
091                        return A;
092                }
093                else if (values.length != rows * cols) {
094                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("wrong number of matrix values: " 
095                                        + values.length + " instead of " + rows*cols);
096                }
097                
098                for (int i = 0, r = 0; r < rows; r++) {
099                        for (int c = 0; c < cols; c++) {
100                                A[r][c] = values[i];
101                                i++;
102                        }
103                }               
104                return A;
105        }
106        
107        /**
108         * <p>
109         * Creates and returns a {@code float[][]} matrix containing the specified values.
110         * Throws an {@link IllegalArgumentException} if the number of supplied values does
111         * not exactly match the matrix size. Example for creating a 2x3 matrix:
112         * </p>
113         * <pre>
114         * float[][] A = makeFloatMatrix(2, 3, 
115         *              1.0f, 2.0f, 3.0f,
116         *              4.0f, 5.0f, 6.0f );</pre>
117         * <p>
118         * See also {@link #flatten(float[][])}.
119         * </p>
120         * 
121         * @param rows the number of matrix rows
122         * @param cols the number of matrix columns
123         * @param values a sequence of matrix values in row-major order (may also be passed as a {@code float[]})
124         * @return a {@code float[][]} matrix
125         */
126        public static float[][] makeFloatMatrix(final int rows, final int cols, final float... values) {
127                final float[][] A = new float[rows][cols];
128                if (values == null || values.length == 0) {
129                        return A;
130                }
131                else if (values.length != rows * cols) {
132                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("wrong number of matrix values: " 
133                                        + values.length + " instead of " + rows*cols);
134                }       
135                
136                for (int i = 0, r = 0; r < rows; r++) {
137                        for (int c = 0; c < cols; c++) {
138                                A[r][c] = values[i];
139                                i++;
140                        }
141                }               
142                return A;
143        }
144        
145        /**
146         * <p>
147         * Creates and returns a {@link RealMatrix} containing the specified {@code double} values.
148         * Calls {@link #makeDoubleMatrix(int, int, double...)}. Example for creating a 2x3 matrix:
149         * </p>
150         * <pre>
151         * RealMatrix A = makeRealMatrix(2, 3, 
152         *              1.0, 2.0, 3.0,
153         *              4.0, 5.0, 6.0 );</pre>
154         * <p>
155         * See also {@link #flatten(RealMatrix)}.
156         * </p>
157         * @param rows the number of matrix rows
158         * @param cols the number of matrix columns
159         * @param values a sequence of matrix values in row-major order (may also be passed as a {@code double[]})
160         * @return a {@link RealMatrix} 
161         */
162        public static RealMatrix makeRealMatrix(final int rows, final int cols, final double... values) {
163                return MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(makeDoubleMatrix(rows, cols, values));
164        }
165        
166
167        /**
168         * Returns the values of the specified matrix as a {@code double[]}
169         * with elements arranged in row-major order.
170         * The matrix must be fully rectangular (all rows of same length).
171         * See also {@link #makeDoubleMatrix(int, int, double...)}.
172         *  
173         * @param A a matrix
174         * @return a {@code double[]} with the matrix elements
175         */
176        public static double[] flatten(double[][] A) {
177                final int rows = A.length;
178                final int cols = A[0].length;
179                final double[] vals = new double[rows * cols];
180                int i = 0;
181                for (int r = 0; r < rows; r++) {
182                        for (int c = 0; c < cols; c++) {
183                                vals[i] = A[r][c];
184                                i++;
185                        }
186                }
187                return vals;
188        }
189        
190        /**
191         * Returns the values of the specified matrix as a {@code float[]}
192         * with elements arranged in row-major order.
193         * The matrix must be fully rectangular (all rows of same length).
194         * See also {@link #makeFloatMatrix(int, int, float...)}.
195         *  
196         * @param A a matrix
197         * @return a {@code float[]} with the matrix elements
198         */
199        public static float[] flatten(float[][] A) {
200                final int rows = A.length;
201                final int cols = A[0].length;
202                final float[] vals = new float[rows * cols];
203                int i = 0;
204                for (int r = 0; r < rows; r++) {
205                        for (int c = 0; c < cols; c++) {
206                                vals[i] = A[r][c];
207                                i++;
208                        }
209                }
210                return vals;
211        }
212        
213        /**
214         * Returns the values of the specified matrix as a {@code double[]}
215         * with elements arranged in row-major order.
216         * See also {@link #makeRealMatrix(int, int, double...)}.
217         *  
218         * @param A a matrix
219         * @return a {@code double[]} with the matrix elements
220         */
221        public static double[] flatten(RealMatrix A) {
222                return flatten(A.getData());
223        }
224        
225        // --------------------------------------------------------------------------
226        
227        /**
228         * Creates and returns a {@code double[]} vector from the
229         * specified values.
230         * 
231         * @param values a sequence of vector values (may also be passed as a single {@code double[]})
232         * @return a {@code double[]}
233         */
234        public static double[] makeDoubleVector(double... values) {
235                return values;
236        }
237        
238        /**
239         * Creates and returns a {@code float[]} vector from the
240         * specified values.
241         * 
242         * @param values a sequence of vector values (may also be passed as a single {@code float[]})
243         * @return a {@code float[]}
244         */
245        public static float[] makeFloatVector(float... values) {
246                return values;
247        }
248        
249        /**
250         * Creates and returns a {@link RealVector} from the
251         * specified {@code double} values.
252         * 
253         * @param values a sequence of vector values (may also be passed as a single {@code double[]})
254         * @return a {@link RealVector} 
255         */
256        public static RealVector makeRealVector(double... values) {
257                return MatrixUtils.createRealVector(values);
258//              return new ArrayRealVector(values);
259        }
260        
261        // Specific vector/matrix creation:
262        
263        /**
264         * Creates and returns a new zero-valued {@code double[]} vector of the 
265         * specified length.
266         * Throws an exception if the length is less than 1.
267         * @param length the length of the vector
268         * @return a {@code double[]} with zero values
269         */
270        public static double[] zeroVector(int length) {
271                if (length < 1)
272                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("vector size cannot be < 1");
273                return new double[length];
274        }
275        
276        /**
277         * Creates and returns a new identity matrix of the 
278         * specified size.
279         * Throws an exception if the size is less than 1.
280         * @param size the size of the matrix
281         * @return an identity matrix
282         */
283        public static double[][] idMatrix(int size) {
284                if (size < 1)
285                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("matrix size cannot be < 1");
286                double[][] A = new double[size][size];
287                for (int i = 0; i < size; i++) {
288                        A[i][i] = 1;
289                }
290                return A;
291        }
292        
293        // Matrix properties -------------------------------------
294
295        /**
296         * Returns the number of rows of the specified {@code double} matrix.
297         * @param A a {@code double[][]} matrix
298         * @return the number of rows
299         */
300        public static int getNumberOfRows(double[][] A) {
301                return A.length;
302        }
303        
304        
305        /**
306         * Returns the number of columns of the specified {@code double} matrix.
307         * @param A a {@code double[][]} matrix
308         * @return the number of columns
309         */
310        public static int getNumberOfColumns(double[][] A) {
311                return A[0].length;
312        }
313        
314        /**
315         * Returns the number of rows of the specified {@code float} matrix.
316         * @param A a {@code float[][]} matrix
317         * @return the number of rows
318         */
319        public static int getNumberOfRows(float[][] A) {
320                return A.length;
321        }
322        
323        /**
324         * Returns the number of columns of the specified {@code float} matrix.
325         * @param A a {@code float[][]} matrix
326         * @return the number of columns
327         */
328        public static int getNumberOfColumns(float[][] A) {
329                return A[0].length;
330        }
331        
332        /**
333         * Returns the number of rows of the specified {@link RealMatrix}.
334         * @param A a {@link RealMatrix}
335         * @return the number of rows
336         */
337        public static int getNumberOfRows(RealMatrix A) {
338                return A.getRowDimension();
339        }
340        
341        /**
342         * Returns the number of columns of the specified {@link RealMatrix}.
343         * @param A a {@link RealMatrix}
344         * @return the number of columns
345         */
346        public static int getNumberOfColumns(RealMatrix A) {
347                return A.getColumnDimension();
348        }
349        
350        // Extract rows or columns
351        
352        /**
353         * Returns a particular row of the specified {@code double} matrix 
354         * as a {@code double} vector.
355         * @param A a {@code double[][]} matrix
356         * @param r the row index (starting with 0)
357         * @return a {@code double} vector
358         */
359        public static double[] getRow(double[][] A, int r) {
360                return A[r].clone();
361        }
362        
363        /**
364         * Returns a particular row of the specified {@code float} matrix 
365         * as a {@code float} vector.
366         * @param A a {@code float[][]} matrix
367         * @param r the row index (starting with 0)
368         * @return a {@code float} vector
369         */
370        public static float[] getRow(float[][] A, int r) {
371                return A[r].clone();
372        }
373        
374        /**
375         * Returns a particular column of the specified {@code double} matrix 
376         * as a {@code double} vector.
377         * @param A a {@code double[][]} matrix
378         * @param c the column index (starting with 0)
379         * @return a {@code double} vector
380         */
381        public static double[] getColumn(double[][] A, int c) {
382                final int rows = A.length;
383                double[] col = new double[rows];
384                for (int r = 0; r < rows; r++) {
385                        col[r] = A[r][c];
386                }
387                return col;
388        }
389        
390        /**
391         * Returns a particular column of the specified {@code float} matrix 
392         * as a {@code float} vector.
393         * @param A a {@code float[][]} matrix
394         * @param c the column index (starting with 0)
395         * @return a {@code float} vector
396         */
397        public static float[] getColumn(float[][] A, int c) {
398                final int rows = A.length;
399                float[] col = new float[rows];
400                for (int r = 0; r < rows; r++) {
401                        col[r] = A[r][c];
402                }
403                return col;
404        }
405        
406        // Checking vector/matrix dimensions
407        
408        /**
409         * Checks if all rows of the given matrix have the same length.
410         * @param A a {@code float[][]} matrix
411         * @return true iff the matrix is rectangular
412         */
413        public static boolean isRectangular(float[][] A) {
414                final int nCols = A[0].length;
415                for (int i = 1; i < A.length; i++) {
416                        if (A[i].length != nCols) {
417                                return false;
418                        }
419                }
420                return true;
421        }
422        
423        /**
424         * Checks if all rows of the given matrix have the same length.
425         * @param A a {@code double[][]} matrix
426         * @return true iff the matrix is rectangular
427         */
428        public static boolean isRectangular(double[][] A) {
429                final int nCols = A[0].length;
430                for (int i = 1; i < A.length; i++) {
431                        if (A[i].length != nCols) {
432                                return false;
433                        }
434                }
435                return true;
436        }
437        
438        /** Checks it the given matrix has the same number of rows
439         * and columns.
440         * @param A a {@code double[][]} matrix
441         * @return true iff the matrix is square
442         */
443        public static boolean isSquare(double[][] A) {
444                return A.length > 0 && A.length == A[0].length;
445        }
446        
447        /** Checks it the given matrix has the same number of rows
448         * and columns.
449         * @param A a {@code float[][]} matrix
450         * @return true iff the matrix is square
451         */
452        public static boolean isSquare(float[][] A) {
453                return A.length > 0 && A.length == A[0].length;
454        }
455        
456        /**
457         * Returns a vector with the diagonal elements of the specified matrix.
458         * @param A a square {@code double[][]} matrix
459         * @return the vector of diagonal elements
460         */
461        public static double[] getDiagonal(double[][] A) {
462                if (!isSquare(A)) {
463                        throw new NonsquareMatrixException();
464                }
465                final int n = A.length;
466                double[] diag = new double[n];
467                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
468                        diag[i] = A[i][i];
469                }
470                return diag;
471        }
472        
473        /**
474         * Returns a vector with the diagonal elements of the specified matrix.
475         * @param A a square {@code float[][]} matrix
476         * @return the vector of diagonal elements
477         */
478        public static float[] getDiagonal(float[][] A) {
479                if (!isSquare(A)) {
480                        throw new NonsquareMatrixException();
481                }
482                final int n = A.length;
483                float[] diag = new float[n];
484                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
485                        diag[i] = A[i][i];
486                }
487                return diag;
488        }
489        
490        /**
491         * Returns a vector with the diagonal elements of the specified matrix.
492         * @param A a square {@link RealMatrix}
493         * @return the {@link RealVector} of diagonal elements
494         */
495        public static RealVector getDiagonal(RealMatrix A) {
496                return MatrixUtils.createRealVector(getDiagonal(A.getData()));
497        }
498        
499        /**
500         * Creates and returns a diagonal matrix from the specified 
501         * vector. See also {@link #getDiagonal(double[][])}.
502         * 
503         * @param d vector of diagonal matrix elements
504         * @return a diagonal matrix
505         */
506        public double[][] diagMatrix(double[] d) {
507                return MatrixUtils.createRealDiagonalMatrix(d).getData();
508        }
509        
510        /**
511         * Checks is the given square {@code double[][]} matrix is non-singular.
512         * 
513         * @param A a square {@code double[][]} matrix
514         * @return true if the matrix is singular
515         * @throws NonsquareMatrixException if the matrix is not square
516         */
517        public static boolean isSingular(double[][] A) throws NonsquareMatrixException {
518                if (!Matrix.isSquare(A)) {
519                        throw new NonsquareMatrixException();
520                }       
521                return isSingular(new Array2DRowRealMatrix(A));
522        }
523        
524        /**
525         * Checks is the given square matrix is non-singular.
526         * 
527         * @param A a square {@link RealMatrix}
528         * @return true if the matrix is singular
529         * @throws NonsquareMatrixException if the matrix is not square
530         */
531        public static boolean isSingular(RealMatrix A) throws NonsquareMatrixException {
532                if (!A.isSquare()) {
533                        throw new NonsquareMatrixException();
534                }               
535                DecompositionSolver solver = new LUDecomposition(A).getSolver();
536                return !solver.isNonSingular();
537        }
538        
539        /** Default matrix symmetry tolerance. */
540        public static final double DefaultSymmetryTolerance = 1e-12;
541        
542        /**
543         * Checks is the given square matrix is symmetric
544         * using the specified relative tolerance.
545         * @param A a square matrix
546         * @param relTolerance relative symmetry tolerance
547         * @return true if the matrix is symmetric
548         */
549        public static boolean isSymmetric(RealMatrix A, double relTolerance) {
550                return MatrixUtils.isSymmetric(A, relTolerance);
551        }
552        
553        /**
554         * Checks is the given square matrix is symmetric,
555         * using the default tolerance value ({@link Arithmetic#EPSILON_DOUBLE}).
556         * @param A a square matrix
557         * @return true if the matrix is symmetric
558         */
559        public static boolean isSymmetric(RealMatrix A) {
560                return isSymmetric(A, DefaultSymmetryTolerance);
561        }
562        
563        /**
564         * Checks is the given square matrix is symmetric
565         * using the specified relative tolerance.
566         * @param A a square matrix
567         * @param relTolerance relative symmetry tolerance
568         * @return true if the matrix is symmetric
569         */
570        public static boolean isSymmetric(double[][] A, double relTolerance) {
571                return MatrixUtils.isSymmetric(MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(A), relTolerance);
572        }
573        
574        /**
575         * Checks is the given square matrix is symmetric,
576         * using the default tolerance value ({@link Arithmetic#EPSILON_DOUBLE}).
577         * @param A a square matrix
578         * @return true if the matrix is symmetric
579         */
580        public static boolean isSymmetric(double[][] A) {
581                return isSymmetric(A, DefaultSymmetryTolerance);
582        }
583        
584        /**
585         * Checks is the given square matrix is positive definite,
586         * using the specified symmetry tolerance value.
587         * 
588         * @param A a square matrix
589         * @param tolerance the absolute positivity and relative symmetry tolerance
590         * @return true if the matrix is positive definite
591         */
592        public static boolean isPositiveDefinite(RealMatrix A, double tolerance) { //TODO: split tolerance in two parameters
593                try {
594                        new CholeskyDecomposition(A, tolerance, tolerance);
595                        return true;
596                } catch (NonPositiveDefiniteMatrixException e) {};
597                return false;
598        }
599        
600        /**
601         * Checks is the given square matrix is positive definite.
602         * @param A a square matrix
603         * @return true if the matrix is positive definite
604         */
605        public static boolean isPositiveDefinite(RealMatrix A) {
606                return isPositiveDefinite(A, Arithmetic.EPSILON_DOUBLE);
607        }
608        
609        /**
610         * Checks if the given vectors have the same length.
611         * @param a first vector
612         * @param b second vector
613         * @return true iff both vectors have the same length
614         */
615        public static boolean sameSize(double[] a, double[] b) {
616                return a.length == b.length;
617        }
618        
619        /**
620         * Checks if the given vectors have the same length.
621         * @param a first vector
622         * @param b second vector
623         * @return true iff both vectors have the same length
624         */
625        public static boolean sameSize(float[] a, float[] b) {
626                return a.length == b.length;
627        }
628        
629        /**
630         * Checks if the given matrices have the same size.
631         * @param A first matrix
632         * @param B second matrix
633         * @return true iff both matrices have the same size
634         */
635        public static boolean sameSize(double[][] A, double[][] B) {
636                return (A.length == B.length) && (A[0].length == B[0].length);
637        }
638        
639        /**
640         * Checks if the given matrices have the same size.
641         * @param A first matrix
642         * @param B second matrix
643         * @return true iff both matrices have the same size
644         */
645        public static boolean sameSize(float[][] A, float[][] B) {
646                return (A.length == B.length) && (A[0].length == B[0].length);
647        }
648
649        // Matrix and vector duplication ------------------------------
650
651        /**
652         * Returns a copy of the given {@code double[]} vector. 
653         * @param a a {@code double[]} vector
654         * @return a copy of the vector
655         */
656        public static double[] duplicate(final double[] a) {
657                return a.clone();
658        }
659        
660        /**
661         * Returns a copy of the given {@code float[]} vector. 
662         * @param a a {@code float[]} vector
663         * @return a copy of the vector
664         */
665        public static float[] duplicate(final float[] a) {
666                return a.clone();
667        }
668
669        /**
670         * Returns a copy of the given {@code double[][]} matrix. 
671         * @param A a {@code double[][]} matrix
672         * @return a copy of the matrix
673         */
674        public static double[][] duplicate(final double[][] A) {
675                final int m = A.length;
676                final double[][] B = new double[m][];
677                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
678                        B[i] = A[i].clone();
679                }
680                return B;
681        }
682        
683        /**
684         * Returns a copy of the given {@code float[][]} matrix. 
685         * @param A a {@code float[][]} matrix
686         * @return a copy of the matrix
687         */
688        public static float[][] duplicate(final float[][] A) {
689                final int m = A.length;
690                float[][] B = new float[m][];
691                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
692                        B[i] = A[i].clone();
693                }
694                return B;
695        }
696        
697        // vector copying ------------------------------
698        
699        /**
700         * Copy data from one {@code float[]} vector to another.
701         * The two vectors must have the same length (not checked).
702         * @param source the source vector (unmodified)
703         * @param target the target vector (modified)
704         */
705        public static void copyD(float[] source, float[] target) {
706                System.arraycopy(source, 0, target, 0, source.length);
707        }
708        
709        /**
710         * Copy data from one {@code double[]} vector to another.
711         * The two vectors must have the same length (not checked).
712         * @param source the source vector (unmodified)
713         * @param target the target vector (modified)
714         */
715        public static void copyD(double[] source, double[] target) {
716                System.arraycopy(source, 0, target, 0, source.length);
717        }
718        
719        // ----- double <-> float conversions -----------------
720        
721        /**
722         * Converts a {@code double[]} to a {@code float[]}.
723         * @param a the original {@code double[]} array
724         * @return a copy of the array of type {@code float[]}
725         */
726        public static float[] toFloat(final double[] a) {
727                final int m = a.length;
728                final float[] b = new float[m];
729                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
730                        b[i] = (float) a[i];
731                }
732                return b;
733        }
734        
735        /**
736         * Converts a {@code double[][]} to a {@code float[][]}.
737         * @param A the original {@code double[][]} array
738         * @return a copy of the array of type {@code float[][]}
739         */
740        public static float[][] toFloat(final double[][] A) {
741                final int m = A.length;
742                final int n = A[0].length;
743                final float[][] B = new float[m][n];
744                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
745                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
746                                B[i][j] = (float) A[i][j];
747                        }
748                }
749                return B;
750        }
751        
752        /**
753         * Converts a {@code double[][]} to a {@code long[][]} whose elements contain
754         * the 64-bit representation of the original {@code double} values. Its printed
755         * representation is comparatively compact (see {@link #toString(long[][])}).
756         * This is useful for defining literal {@code double} arrays without losing any
757         * precision (by avoiding conversion to decimal representation). Note that the
758         * {@code long} are bit representations and cannot be used to perform any
759         * arithmetic calculations.
760         * 
761         * @param A the original {@code double} array
762         * @return a copy of the array of type {@code float[][]}
763         * @see #fromLongBits(long[][])
764         * @see #toString(long[][])
765         * @see #printToStream(long[][], PrintStream)
766         */
767        public static long[][] toLongBits(final double[][] A) {
768                final int m = A.length;
769                final int n = A[0].length;
770                final long[][] B = new long[m][n];
771                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
772                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
773                                B[i][j] = Double.doubleToLongBits(A[i][j]);
774                        }
775                }
776                return B;
777        }
778        
779        /**
780         * Converts a {@code long[][]} with 64-bit {@code double} representations to the
781         * equivalent {@code double[][]}. This is useful for defining literal
782         * {@code double} arrays without losing any precision (by avoiding conversion to
783         * decimal representation).
784         * 
785         * @param A a {@code long} array
786         * @return the equivalent {@code double} array
787         * @see #toLongBits(double[][])
788         */
789        public static double[][] fromLongBits(final long[][] A) {
790                final int m = A.length;
791                final int n = A[0].length;
792                final double[][] B = new double[m][n];
793                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
794                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
795                                B[i][j] = Double.longBitsToDouble(A[i][j]);
796                        }
797                }
798                return B;
799        }
800        
801        /**
802         * Converts a {@code float[]} to a {@code double[]}.
803         * @param a the original {@code float[]} array
804         * @return a copy of the array of type {@code double[]}
805         */
806        public static double[] toDouble(final float[] a) {
807                final int m = a.length;
808                final double[] B = new double[m];
809                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
810                        B[i] = a[i];
811                }
812                return B;
813        }
814        
815        /**
816         * Converts a {@code float[][]} to a {@code double[][]}.
817         * @param A the original {@code float[][]} array
818         * @return a copy of the array of type {@code double[][]}
819         */
820        public static double[][] toDouble(final float[][] A) {
821                final int m = A.length;
822                final int n = A[0].length;
823                final double[][] B = new double[m][n];
824                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
825                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
826                                B[i][j] = A[i][j];
827                        }
828                }
829                return B;
830        }
831        
832        // ----------- fill operations (destructive) ------------------------
833        
834        /**
835         * Fills the given {@code double} vector with the specified value (destructively).
836         * @param x a vector (which is modified)
837         * @param val the fill value
838         */
839        public static void fillD(final double[] x, double val) {
840                Arrays.fill(x, val);
841        }
842        
843        /**
844         * Fills the given {@code float} vector with the specified value (destructively).
845         * @param x a vector (which is modified)
846         * @param val the fill value
847         */
848        public static void fillD(final float[] x, float val) {
849                Arrays.fill(x, val);
850        }
851        
852        /**
853         * Fills the given {@code double} matrix with the specified value (destructively).
854         * @param A a matrix (which is modified)
855         * @param val the fill value
856         */
857        public static void fillD(final double[][] A, double val) {
858                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) { 
859                        Arrays.fill(A[i], val);
860                }
861        }
862        
863        /**
864         * Fills the given {@code float} matrix with the specified value (destructively).
865         * @param A a matrix (which is modified)
866         * @param val the fill value
867         */
868        public static void fillD(final float[][] A, float val) {
869                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) { 
870                        Arrays.fill(A[i], val);
871                }
872        }
873        
874
875        // Element-wise arithmetic -------------------------------
876        
877        /**
878         * Calculates and returns the sum of the specified {@code double} vectors
879         * (non-destructively). An exception is thrown if the vectors are of
880         * different lengths.
881         * None of the arguments is modified.
882         * @param a the first vector
883         * @param b the second vector
884         * @return a new {@code double} vector
885         */
886        public static double[] add(final double[] a, final double[] b) {
887                double[] c = b.clone();
888                addD(a, c);
889                return c;
890        }
891        
892        /**
893         * Adds the elements of the first {@code double} vector
894         * to the second vector (destructively).
895         * An exception is thrown if the vectors are of
896         * different lengths.
897         * The second vector is modified.
898         * @param a the first vector
899         * @param b the second vector
900         */
901        public static void addD(final double[] a, final double[] b) {
902                if (!sameSize(a, b))
903                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
904                for (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
905                        b[i] = a[i] + b[i];
906                }
907        }
908        
909        /**
910         * Calculates and returns the sum of the specified {@code float} vectors
911         * (non-destructively). An exception is thrown if the vectors are of
912         * different lengths.
913         * None of the arguments is modified.
914         * @param a the first vector
915         * @param b the second vector
916         * @return a new {@code float} vector
917         */
918        public static float[] add(final float[] a, final float[] b) {
919                float[] c = b.clone();
920                addD(a, c);
921                return c;
922        }
923        
924        /**
925         * Adds the elements of the first {@code float} vector
926         * to the second vector (destructively).
927         * An exception is thrown if the vectors are of different lengths.
928         * The second vector is modified.
929         * @param a the first vector
930         * @param b the second vector
931         */
932        public static void addD(final float[] a, final float[] b) {
933                if (!sameSize(a, b))
934                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
935                for (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
936                        b[i] = a[i] + b[i];
937                }
938        }
939
940        /**
941         * Calculates and returns the sum of the specified {@code double} matrix
942         * (non-destructively). An exception is thrown if the matrices are of
943         * different size.
944         * None of the arguments is modified.
945         * @param A the first matrix
946         * @param B the second matrix
947         * @return a new {@code double} matrix
948         */
949        public static double[][] add(final double[][] A, final double[][] B) {
950                double[][] C = duplicate(B);
951                addD(A, C);
952                return C;
953        }
954        
955        /**
956         * Adds the elements of the first {@code double} matrix
957         * to the second vector (destructively).
958         * An exception is thrown if the matrices are of
959         * different size.
960         * The second matrix is modified.
961         * @param A the first matrix
962         * @param B the second matrix
963         */
964        public static void addD(final double[][] A, final double[][] B) {
965                if (!sameSize(A, B))
966                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
967                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) {
968                        for (int j = 0; j < A[i].length; j++) {
969                                B[i][j] = A[i][j] + B[i][j];
970                        }
971                }
972        }
973        
974        /**
975         * Calculates and returns the sum of the specified {@code float} matrix
976         * (non-destructively). An exception is thrown if the matrices are of
977         * different size.
978         * None of the arguments is modified.
979         * @param A the first matrix
980         * @param B the second matrix
981         * @return a new {@code float} matrix
982         */
983        public static float[][] add(final float[][] A, final float[][] B) {
984                float[][] C = duplicate(B);
985                addD(A, C);
986                return C;
987        }
988        
989        /**
990         * Adds the elements of the first {@code float} matrix
991         * to the second vector (destructively).
992         * An exception is thrown if the matrices are of
993         * different size.
994         * The second matrix is modified.
995         * @param A the first matrix
996         * @param B the second matrix
997         */
998        public static void addD(final float[][] A, final float[][] B) {
999                if (!sameSize(A, B))
1000                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
1001                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) {
1002                        for (int j = 0; j < A[i].length; j++) {
1003                                B[i][j] = A[i][j] + B[i][j];
1004                        }
1005                }
1006        }
1007        
1008        // ------------------------------------------------
1009        
1010        /**
1011         * Calculates and returns the difference (a - b) of the specified {@code double} vectors
1012         * (non-destructively). An exception is thrown if the vectors are of
1013         * different lengths.
1014         * None of the arguments is modified.
1015         * @param a the first vector
1016         * @param b the second vector
1017         * @return a new {@code double} vector
1018         */
1019        public static double[] subtract(final double[] a, final double[] b) {
1020                if (!sameSize(a, b))
1021                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
1022                final int n = a.length;
1023                double[] c = new double[n];
1024                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
1025                        c[i] = a[i] - b[i];
1026                }
1027                return c;
1028        }
1029        
1030        // non-destructive a - b
1031        /**
1032         * Calculates and returns the difference (a - b) of the specified {@code float} vectors
1033         * (non-destructively). An exception is thrown if the vectors are of
1034         * different lengths.
1035         * None of the arguments is modified.
1036         * @param a the first vector
1037         * @param b the second vector
1038         * @return a new {@code float} vector
1039         */
1040        public static float[] subtract(final float[] a, final float[] b) {
1041                if (!sameSize(a, b))
1042                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
1043                final int n = a.length;
1044                float[] c = new float[n];
1045                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
1046                        c[i] = a[i] - b[i];
1047                }
1048                return c;
1049        }
1050
1051        // Scalar multiplications -------------------------------
1052
1053        // non-destructive
1054        /**
1055         * Multiplies a {@code double[]} vector by a scalar and returns a new
1056         * {@code double[]} vector (non-destructive).
1057         * @param s a scalar
1058         * @param x a vector
1059         * @return a new vector
1060         */
1061        public static double[] multiply(final double s, final double[] x) {
1062                double[] b = x.clone();
1063                multiplyD(s, b);
1064                return b;
1065        }
1066        
1067        // destructive
1068        /**
1069         * Multiplies a {@code double[]} vector by a scalar.
1070         * Destructive, i.e., the specified vector is modified.
1071         * @param s a scalar
1072         * @param x a vector
1073         */
1074        public static void multiplyD(final double s, final double[] x) {
1075                for (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
1076                        x[i] = x[i] * s;
1077                }
1078        }
1079        
1080        // non-destructive
1081        /**
1082         * Multiplies a {@code double[][]} matrix by a scalar and returns a new
1083         * {@code double[][]} matrix (non-destructive).
1084         * @param s a scalar
1085         * @param A a matrix
1086         * @return a new matrix
1087         */
1088        public static double[][] multiply(final double s, final double[][] A) {
1089                double[][] B = duplicate(A);
1090                multiplyD(s, B);
1091                return B;
1092        }
1093        
1094        /**
1095         * Multiplies a {@code double[][]} matrix by a scalar.
1096         * Destructive, i.e., the specified matrix is modified.
1097         * @param s a scalar
1098         * @param A a matrix
1099         */
1100        public static void multiplyD(final double s, final double[][] A) {
1101                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) {
1102                        for (int j = 0; j < A[i].length; j++) {
1103                                A[i][j] = A[i][j] * s;
1104                        }
1105                }
1106        }
1107        
1108        // non-destructive
1109        /**
1110         * Multiplies a {@code float[]} vector by a scalar and returns a new
1111         * {@code float[]} vector (non-destructive).
1112         * @param s a scalar
1113         * @param x a vector
1114         * @return a new vector
1115         */
1116        public static float[] multiply(final float s, final float[] x) {
1117                float[] B = duplicate(x);
1118                multiplyD(s, B);
1119                return B;
1120        }
1121        
1122        // destructive
1123        /**
1124         * Multiplies a {@code float[]} vector by a scalar.
1125         * Destructive, i.e., the specified vector is modified.
1126         * @param s a scalar
1127         * @param x a matrix
1128         */
1129        public static void multiplyD(final float s, final float[] x) {
1130                for (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
1131                        x[i] = x[i] * s;
1132                }
1133        }
1134
1135        // non-destructive
1136        /**
1137         * Multiplies a {@code float[][]} matrix by a scalar and returns a new
1138         * {@code float[][]} matrix (non-destructive).
1139         * @param s a scalar
1140         * @param A a matrix
1141         * @return a new matrix
1142         */
1143        public static float[][] multiply(final float s, final float[][] A) {
1144                float[][] B = duplicate(A);
1145                multiplyD(s, B);
1146                return B;
1147        }
1148        
1149        // destructive
1150        /**
1151         * Multiplies a {@code float[][]} matrix by a scalar.
1152         * Destructive, i.e., the specified matrix is modified.
1153         * @param s a scalar
1154         * @param A a matrix
1155         */
1156        public static void multiplyD(final float s, final float[][] A) {
1157                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) {
1158                        for (int j = 0; j < A[i].length; j++) {
1159                                A[i][j] = A[i][j] * s;
1160                        }
1161                }
1162        }
1163        
1164        // matrix-vector multiplications ----------------------------------------
1165
1166        /**
1167         * Multiplies a vector x with a matrix A "from the left", i.e., y = x * A,
1168         * where x is treated as a row vector and the result y is also a row vector.
1169         * @param x a (row) vector of length m
1170         * @param A a matrix of size (m,n)
1171         * @return a (row) vector of length n
1172         */
1173        public static double[] multiply(final double[] x, final double[][] A) {
1174                double[] y = new double[getNumberOfColumns(A)];
1175                multiplyD(x, A, y);
1176                return y;
1177        }
1178        
1179        /**
1180         * Destructive version of {@link #multiply(double[], double[][])}.
1181         * @param x a (row) vector of length m
1182         * @param A matrix of size (m,n)
1183         * @param y a (row) vector of length n
1184         */
1185        public static void multiplyD(final double[] x, final double[][] A, double[] y) {
1186                if (x == y) 
1187                        throw new SameSourceTargetException();
1188                final int m = getNumberOfRows(A);
1189                final int n = getNumberOfColumns(A);
1190                if (x.length != m || y.length != n) 
1191                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
1192                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
1193                        double s = 0;
1194                        for (int j = 0; j < m; j++) {
1195                                s = s + x[j] * A[j][i];
1196                        }
1197                        y[i] = s;
1198                }
1199        }
1200
1201        /**
1202         * Multiplies a matrix A with a vector x "from the right", i.e., y = A * x,
1203         * where x is treated as a column vector and the result y is also a column vector.
1204         * @param x a (column) vector of length n
1205         * @param A a matrix of size (m,n)
1206         * @return a (column) vector of length m
1207         */
1208        public static double[] multiply(final double[][] A, final double[] x) {
1209                double[] y = new double[getNumberOfRows(A)];
1210                multiplyD(A, x, y);
1211                return y;
1212        }
1213        
1214        /**
1215         * Multiplies a matrix A with a vector x "from the right", i.e., y = A * x,
1216         * where x is treated as a column vector and the result y is also a column vector.
1217         * The result is placed in the vector passed as the last argument, 
1218         * which is modified.
1219         * Destructive version of {@link #multiply(double[][], double[])}.
1220         * An exception is thrown if any matrix or vector dimensions do not match
1221         * or if the two vectors are the same.
1222         * @param A matrix of size (m,n)
1223         * @param x a (column) vector of length n
1224         * @param y a (column) vector of length m
1225         */
1226        public static void multiplyD(final double[][] A, final double[] x, double[] y) {
1227                if (x == y) 
1228                        throw new SameSourceTargetException();
1229                final int m = getNumberOfRows(A);
1230                final int n = getNumberOfColumns(A);
1231                if (x.length != n || y.length != m) 
1232                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
1233                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
1234                        double s = 0;
1235                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
1236                                s = s + A[i][j] * x[j];
1237                        }
1238                        y[i] = s;
1239                }
1240        }
1241        
1242        /**
1243         * Multiplies a matrix A with a vector x from the right, i.e., y = A * x,
1244         * where x is treated as a column vector and the result y is also a column vector.
1245         * @param x a (column) vector of length n
1246         * @param A a matrix of size (m,n)
1247         * @return a (column) vector of length m
1248         */
1249        public static float[] multiply(final float[][] A, final float[] x) {
1250                float[] y = new float[getNumberOfRows(A)];
1251                multiplyD(A, x, y);
1252                return y;
1253        }
1254        
1255        /**
1256         * Multiplies a matrix A with a vector x "from the right", i.e., y = A * x,
1257         * where x is treated as a column vector and the result y is also a column vector.
1258         * The result is placed in the vector passed as the last argument, 
1259         * which is modified.
1260         * Destructive version of {@link #multiply(float[][], float[])}.
1261         * An exception is thrown if any matrix or vector dimensions do not match
1262         * or if the two vectors are the same.
1263         * @param A matrix of size (m,n)
1264         * @param x a (column) vector of length n
1265         * @param y a (column) vector of length m
1266         */
1267        public static void multiplyD(final float[][] A, final float[] x, float[] y) {
1268                if (x == y) 
1269                        throw new SameSourceTargetException();
1270                final int m = getNumberOfRows(A);
1271                final int n = getNumberOfColumns(A);
1272                if (x.length != n || y.length != m) 
1273                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
1274                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
1275                        double s = 0;
1276                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
1277                                s = s + A[i][j] * x[j];
1278                        }
1279                        y[i] = (float) s;
1280                }
1281        }
1282        
1283
1284        // Matrix-matrix products ---------------------------------------
1285        
1286        // returns A * B (non-destructive)
1287        /**
1288         * Returns the product of two {@code double[][]} matrices A, B
1289         * as a new {@code double[][]} matrix.
1290         * Non-destructive, i.e., none of the arguments is modified.
1291         * @param A first matrix
1292         * @param B second matrix
1293         * @return the matrix product A * B
1294         */
1295        public static double[][] multiply(final double[][] A, final double[][] B) {
1296                final int nA = getNumberOfColumns(A);
1297                final int mB = getNumberOfRows(B);
1298                if (nA != mB)
1299                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();    // check size of A, B
1300                int ma = getNumberOfRows(A);
1301                int nb = getNumberOfColumns(B);
1302                double[][] C = makeDoubleMatrix(ma, nb);
1303                multiplyD(A, B, C);
1304                return C;
1305        }
1306        
1307        // A * B -> C (destructive)
1308        /**
1309         * Calculates the product of two {@code double[][]} matrices A, B and places the
1310         * results in the third {@code double[][]} matrix C, which is modified
1311         * (destructively). An exception is thrown if any matrix dimensions do not match
1312         * or if the target matrix is the same as one of the source matrices.
1313         * 
1314         * @param A first matrix
1315         * @param B second matrix
1316         * @param C the result matrix
1317         * @throws SameSourceTargetException if the target matrix is the same as one of the source matrices
1318         * @throws IncompatibleDimensionsException if any matrix dimensions do not match
1319         */
1320        public static void multiplyD(final double[][] A, final double[][] B, final double[][] C) 
1321                        throws SameSourceTargetException, IncompatibleDimensionsException {
1322                if (A == C || B == C) 
1323                        throw new SameSourceTargetException();
1324                final int mA = getNumberOfRows(A);
1325                final int nA = getNumberOfColumns(A);
1326                final int mB = getNumberOfRows(B);
1327                final int nB = getNumberOfColumns(B);
1328                if (nA != mB)
1329                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();    // check size of A, B
1330                if (mA != getNumberOfRows(C) || nB != getNumberOfColumns(C))
1331                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();    // check size of C
1332                
1333                for (int i = 0; i < mA; i++) {
1334                        for (int j = 0; j < nB; j++) {
1335                                double s = 0;
1336                                for (int k = 0; k < nA; k++) {
1337                                        s = s + A[i][k] * B[k][j];
1338                                }
1339                                C[i][j] = s;
1340                        }
1341                }
1342        }
1343        
1344        // returns A * B (non-destructive)
1345        /**
1346         * Returns the product of two {@code float[][]} matrices A, B
1347         * as a new {@code float[][]} matrix.
1348         * Non-destructive, i.e., none of the arguments is modified.
1349         * @param A first matrix
1350         * @param B second matrix
1351         * @return the matrix product A * B
1352         */
1353        public static float[][] multiply(final float[][] A, final float[][] B) {
1354                final int nA = getNumberOfColumns(A);
1355                final int mB = getNumberOfRows(B);
1356                if (nA != mB)
1357                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();    // check size of A, B
1358                final int mA = getNumberOfRows(A);
1359                final int nB = getNumberOfColumns(B);
1360                float[][] C = makeFloatMatrix(mA, nB);
1361                multiplyD(A, B, C);
1362                return C;
1363        }
1364
1365        // A * B -> C (destructive)
1366        /**
1367         * Calculates the product of two {@code float[][]} matrices A, B
1368         * and places the results in the third {@code float[][]} matrix C,
1369         * which is modified (destructively).
1370         * An exception is thrown if any matrix dimensions do not match
1371         * or if the target matrix is the same as one of the source matrices.
1372         * @param A first matrix
1373         * @param B second matrix
1374         * @param C the result matrix
1375         */
1376        public static void multiplyD(final float[][] A, final float[][] B, final float[][] C) {
1377                if (A == C || B == C) 
1378                        throw new SameSourceTargetException();
1379                final int mA = getNumberOfRows(A);
1380                final int nA = getNumberOfColumns(A);
1381                final int mB = getNumberOfRows(B);
1382                final int nB = getNumberOfColumns(B);
1383                if (nA != mB)
1384                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();    // check size of A,B
1385                if (mA != getNumberOfRows(C) || nB != getNumberOfColumns(C))
1386                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();    // check size of C
1387                for (int i = 0; i < mA; i++) {
1388                        for (int j = 0; j < nB; j++) {
1389                                float s = 0;
1390                                for (int k = 0; k < nA; k++) {
1391                                        s = s + A[i][k] * B[k][j];
1392                                }
1393                                C[i][j] = s;
1394                        }
1395                }
1396        }
1397        
1398        // Vector-vector products ---------------------------------------
1399        
1400        /**
1401         * Calculates and returns the dot (inner or scalar) product of two vectors,
1402         * which must have the same length.
1403         * Throws an exceptions if vector dimensions do not match.
1404         * @param a first vector
1405         * @param b second vector
1406         * @return the dot product
1407         */
1408        public static double dotProduct(final double[] a, final double[] b) {
1409                if (!sameSize(a, b))
1410                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
1411                double sum = 0;
1412                for (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
1413                        sum = sum + a[i] * b[i];
1414                }
1415                return sum;
1416        }
1417        
1418        // a is considered a column vector, b is a row vector, of length m, n, resp.
1419        // returns a matrix M of size (m,n).
1420        /**
1421         * Calculates and returns the outer product of two vectors, which is a
1422         * matrix of size (m,n), where m is the length of the first vector and
1423         * m is the length of the second vector.
1424         * @param a first (column) vector (of length m)
1425         * @param b second (row) vector (of length n)
1426         * @return the outer product (matrix)
1427         */
1428        public static double[][] outerProduct(final double[] a, final double[] b) {
1429                final int m = a.length;
1430                final int n = b.length;
1431                final double[][] M = new double[m][n];
1432                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
1433                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
1434                                M[i][j] = a[i] * b[j];
1435                        }
1436                }
1437                return M;
1438        }
1439
1440        //  Vector norms ---------------------------------------------------
1441
1442        /**
1443         * Calculates and returns the L1 norm of the given vector.
1444         * @param a a vector
1445         * @return the L1 norm of the vector
1446         */
1447        public static double normL1(final double[] a) {
1448                double sum = 0;
1449                for (double val : a) {
1450                        sum = sum + Math.abs(val);
1451                }
1452                return sum;
1453        }
1454        
1455        /**
1456         * Calculates and returns the L1 norm of the given vector.
1457         * @param a a vector
1458         * @return the L1 norm of the vector
1459         */
1460        public static float normL1(final float[] a) {
1461                double sum = 0;
1462                for (double val : a) {
1463                        sum = sum + Math.abs(val);
1464                }
1465                return (float) sum;
1466        }
1467
1468        /**
1469         * Calculates and returns the L2 norm of the given vector.
1470         * @param a a vector
1471         * @return the L2 norm of the vector
1472         */
1473        public static double normL2(final double[] a) {
1474                return Math.sqrt(normL2squared(a));
1475        }
1476
1477        /**
1478         * Calculates and returns the squared L2 norm of the given vector.
1479         * The squared norm is less costly to calculate (no square root
1480         * needed) than the L2 norm and is thus often used for efficiency. 
1481         * @param a a vector
1482         * @return the squared L2 norm of the vector
1483         */
1484        public static double normL2squared(final double[] a) {
1485                double sum = 0;
1486                for (double val : a) {
1487                        sum = sum + sqr(val);
1488                }
1489                return sum;
1490        }
1491
1492        /**
1493         * Calculates and returns the L2 norm of the given vector.
1494         * @param x a vector
1495         * @return the L2 norm of the vector
1496         */
1497        public static float normL2(final float[] x) {
1498                return (float) Math.sqrt(normL2squared(x));
1499        }
1500
1501        /**
1502         * Calculates and returns the squared L2 norm of the given vector.
1503         * The squared norm is less costly to calculate (no square root
1504         * needed) than the L2 norm and is thus often used for efficiency. 
1505         * @param a a vector
1506         * @return the squared L2 norm of the vector
1507         */
1508        public static double normL2squared(final float[] a) {
1509                double sum = 0;
1510                for (double val : a) {
1511                        sum = sum + sqr(val);
1512                }
1513                return sum;
1514        }
1515        
1516        // Normalize vectors
1517        
1518        /**
1519         * Normalizes the specified {@code double[]} vector to unit
1520         * (L2) norm and returns the result as a new {@code double[]} vector.
1521         * @param a a vector
1522         * @return the normalized vector
1523         */
1524        public static double[] normalize(final double[] a) {
1525                double[] xx = duplicate(a);
1526                normalizeD(xx);
1527                return xx;
1528        }
1529        
1530        /**
1531         * Normalizes the specified {@code double[]} vector to unit
1532         * (L2) norm. The vector is modified (destructively).
1533         * @param a a vector
1534         */
1535        public static void normalizeD(final double[] a) {
1536                double normx = normL2(a);
1537                if (Arithmetic.isZero(normx))
1538                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("cannot normalize zero-norm vector " + Matrix.toString(a));
1539                multiplyD(1.0 / normx, a);
1540        }
1541        
1542        /**
1543         * Normalizes the specified {@code float[]} vector to unit
1544         * (L2) norm and returns the result as a new {@code float[]} vector.
1545         * @param a a vector
1546         * @return the normalized vector
1547         */
1548        public static float[] normalize(final float[] a) {
1549                float[] xx = duplicate(a);
1550                normalizeD(xx);
1551                return xx;
1552        }
1553        
1554        /**
1555         * Normalizes the specified {@code float[]} vector to unit
1556         * (L2) norm. The vector is modified (destructively).
1557         * @param a a vector
1558         */
1559        public static void normalizeD(final float[] a) {
1560                double normx = normL2(a);
1561                if (Arithmetic.isZero(normx))
1562                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("cannot normalize zero-norm vector");
1563                multiplyD((float) (1.0 / normx), a);
1564        }
1565        
1566        // Distance between vectors ---------------------------------------
1567        
1568        /** 
1569         * Calculates the L2 distance between two vectors (points)
1570         * in n-dimensional space. Both vectors must have the same 
1571         * number of elements.
1572         * @param a first vector
1573         * @param b second vector
1574         * @return the distance
1575         */
1576        public static double distL2(double[] a, double[] b) {
1577                return Math.sqrt(distL2squared(a, b));
1578        }
1579        
1580        /** 
1581         * Calculates the squared L2 distance between two vectors (points)
1582         * in n-dimensional space. Both vectors must have the same 
1583         * number of elements.
1584         * @param a first vector
1585         * @param b second vector
1586         * @return the squared distance
1587         */
1588        public static double distL2squared(double[] a, double[] b) {
1589                double sum = 0;
1590                for  (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
1591                        sum = sum + sqr(a[i] - b[i]);
1592                }
1593                return sum;
1594        }
1595        
1596        /** 
1597         * Calculates the L2 distance between two vectors (points)
1598         * in n-dimensional space. Both vectors must have the same 
1599         * number of elements.
1600         * @param a first vector
1601         * @param b second vector
1602         * @return the distance
1603         */
1604        public static float distL2(float[] a, float[] b) {
1605                return (float) Math.sqrt(distL2squared(a, b));
1606        }
1607        
1608        /** 
1609         * Calculates the squared L2 distance between two vectors (points)
1610         * in n-dimensional space. Both vectors must have the same 
1611         * number of elements.
1612         * @param a first vector
1613         * @param b second vector
1614         * @return the squared distance
1615         */
1616        public static float distL2squared(float[] a, float[] b) {
1617                double sum = 0;
1618                for  (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
1619                        sum = sum + sqr(a[i] - b[i]);
1620                }
1621                return (float) sum;
1622        }
1623        
1624        // Matrix (Froebenius) norm ---------------------------------------
1625        
1626        /**
1627         * Calculates and returns the Froebenius norm of the given matrix.
1628         * @param A a matrix
1629         * @return the norm of the matrix
1630         */
1631        public static double norm(final double[][] A) {
1632                final int m = getNumberOfRows(A);
1633                final int n = getNumberOfColumns(A);
1634                double s = 0;
1635                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
1636                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
1637                                s = s + sqr(A[i][j]);
1638                        }
1639                }
1640                return Math.sqrt(s);
1641        }
1642
1643        // Summation --------------------------------------------------
1644
1645        /**
1646         * Calculates and returns the sum of the elements in the specified 
1647         * {@code double[]} vector.
1648         * @param a a vector
1649         * @return the sum of vector elements
1650         */
1651        public static double sum(final double[] a) {
1652                double sum = 0;
1653                for (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
1654                        sum = sum + a[i];
1655                }
1656                return sum;
1657        }
1658        
1659        /**
1660         * Calculates and returns the sum of the elements in the specified 
1661         * {@code double[][]} matrix.
1662         * @param A a matrix
1663         * @return the sum of matrix elements
1664         */
1665        public static double sum(final double[][] A) {
1666                double sum = 0;
1667                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) {
1668                        for (int j = 0; j < A[i].length; j++) {
1669                                sum = sum + A[i][j];
1670                        }
1671                }
1672                return sum;
1673        }
1674        
1675        /**
1676         * Calculates and returns the sum of the elements in the specified 
1677         * {@code float[]} vector.
1678         * @param a a vector
1679         * @return the sum of vector elements
1680         */
1681        public static double sum(final float[] a) {
1682                double sum = 0;
1683                for (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
1684                        sum = sum + a[i];
1685                }
1686                return sum;
1687        }
1688        
1689        /**
1690         * Calculates and returns the sum of the elements in the specified 
1691         * {@code float[][]} matrix.
1692         * @param A a matrix
1693         * @return the sum of matrix elements
1694         */
1695        public static double sum(final float[][] A) {
1696                double sum = 0;
1697                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) {
1698                        for (int j = 0; j < A[i].length; j++) {
1699                                sum = sum + A[i][j];
1700                        }
1701                }
1702                return sum;
1703        }
