1706        
1707        /**
1708         * Calculates the sum of the elements in the specified matrix row.
1709         * @param A a matrix
1710         * @param row the row index
1711         * @return the sum of the row's elements
1712         */
1713        public static double sumRow(final double[][] A, final int row) {
1714                return sum(A[row]);
1715        }
1716        
1717        /**
1718         * Calculates the sum of the elements in the specified matrix row.
1719         * @param A a matrix
1720         * @param row the row index
1721         * @return the sum of the row's elements
1722         */
1723        public static double sumRow(final float[][] A, final int row) {
1724                return sum(A[row]);
1725        }
1726        
1727
1728        /**
1729         * Calculates the sum of the elements in the specified matrix column.
1730         * @param A a matrix
1731         * @param col the column index
1732         * @return the sum of the column's elements
1733         */
1734        public static double sumColumn(final double[][] A, final int col) {
1735                double sum = 0;
1736                for (int r = 0; r < A.length; r++) {
1737                        sum = sum + A[r][col];
1738                }
1739                return sum;
1740        }
1741        
1742        /**
1743         * Calculates the sum of the elements in the specified matrix column.
1744         * @param A a matrix
1745         * @param col the column index
1746         * @return the sum of the column's elements
1747         */
1748        public static double sumColumn(final float[][] A, final int col) {
1749                double sum = 0;
1750                for (int r = 0; r < A.length; r++) {
1751                        sum = sum + A[r][col];
1752                }
1753                return sum;
1754        }
1755        
1756        /**
1757         * Calculates the sums of all matrix rows and returns 
1758         * them as a vector with one element per row.
1759         * @param A a matrix of size (M,N)
1760         * @return a vector of length M containing the sums of all matrix columns
1761         */
1762        public static double[] sumRows(final double[][] A) {
1763                double[] sumVec = new double[getNumberOfRows(A)];
1764                for (int i = 0; i < sumVec.length; i++) {
1765                        double sum = 0;
1766                        for (int j = 0; j < A[i].length; j++) {
1767                                sum = sum + A[i][j];
1768                        }
1769                        sumVec[i] = sum;
1770                }
1771                return sumVec;
1772        }
1773        
1774        /**
1775         * Calculates the sums of all matrix rows and returns 
1776         * them as a vector with one element per row.
1777         * @param A a matrix of size (M,N)
1778         * @return a vector of length M containing the sums of all matrix columns
1779         */
1780        public static float[] sumRows(final float[][] A) {
1781                float[] sumVec = new float[getNumberOfRows(A)];
1782                for (int i = 0; i < sumVec.length; i++) {
1783                        double sum = 0;
1784                        for (int j = 0; j < A[i].length; j++) {
1785                                sum = sum + A[i][j];
1786                        }
1787                        sumVec[i] = (float) sum;
1788                }
1789                return sumVec;
1790        }
1791        
1792        /**
1793         * Calculates the sums of all matrix columns and returns
1794         * them as a vector with one element per column.
1795         * @param A a matrix of size (M,N)
1796         * @return a vector of length N containing the sums of all matrix rows
1797         */
1798        public static double[] sumColumns(final double[][] A) {
1799                double[] sumVec = new double[getNumberOfColumns(A)];
1800                for (int c = 0; c < sumVec.length; c++) {
1801                        double sum = 0;
1802                        for (int r = 0; r < A.length; r++) {
1803                                sum = sum + A[r][c];
1804                        }
1805                        sumVec[c] = sum;
1806                }
1807                return sumVec;
1808        }
1809        
1810        /**
1811         * Calculates the sums of all matrix columns and returns
1812         * them as a vector with one element per column.
1813         * @param A a matrix of size (M,N)
1814         * @return a vector of length N containing the sums of all matrix rows
1815         */
1816        public static float[] sumColumns(final float[][] A) {
1817                float[] sumVec = new float[getNumberOfColumns(A)];
1818                for (int c = 0; c < sumVec.length; c++) {
1819                        double sum = 0;
1820                        for (int r = 0; r < A.length; r++) {
1821                                sum = sum + A[r][c];
1822                        }
1823                        sumVec[c] = (float) sum;
1824                }
1825                return sumVec;
1826        }
1827        
1828        // min/max of vectors ------------------------
1829        
1830        /**
1831         * Returns the index of the smallest element in the
1832         * specified vector. If the smallest value is
1833         * not unique, the lowest index is returned.
1834         * An exception is thrown if the vector has zero length.
1835         * 
1836         * @param a a vector
1837         * @return the index of the smallest value
1838         */
1839        public static int idxMin(double[] a) {
1840                if (a.length == 0)
1841                        throw new ZeroLengthVectorException();
1842                double minval = a[0];
1843                int minidx = 0;
1844                for (int i = 1; i < a.length; i++) {
1845                        if (a[i] < minval) {
1846                                minval = a[i];
1847                                minidx = i;
1848                        }
1849                }
1850                return minidx;
1851        }
1852        
1853        /**
1854         * Returns the index of the smallest element in the
1855         * specified vector. If the smallest value is
1856         * not unique, the lowest index is returned.
1857         * An exception is thrown if the vector has zero length.
1858         * 
1859         * @param a a vector
1860         * @return the index of the smallest value
1861         */
1862        public static int idxMin(float[] a) {
1863                if (a.length == 0)
1864                        throw new ZeroLengthVectorException();
1865                float minval = a[0];
1866                int minidx = 0;
1867                for (int i = 1; i < a.length; i++) {
1868                        if (a[i] < minval) {
1869                                minval = a[i];
1870                                minidx = i;
1871                        }
1872                }
1873                return minidx;
1874        }
1875        
1876        
1877        /**
1878         * Returns the index of the largest element in the
1879         * specified vector. If the largest value is
1880         * not unique, the lowest index is returned.
1881         * An exception is thrown if the vector has zero length.
1882         * 
1883         * @param a a vector
1884         * @return the index of the largest value
1885         */
1886        public static int idxMax(double[] a) {
1887                if (a.length == 0)
1888                        throw new ZeroLengthVectorException();
1889                double maxval = a[0];
1890                int maxidx = 0;
1891                for (int i = 1; i < a.length; i++) {
1892                        if (a[i] > maxval) {
1893                                maxval = a[i];
1894                                maxidx = i;
1895                        }
1896                }
1897                return maxidx;
1898        }
1899        
1900        /**
1901         * Returns the index of the largest element in the
1902         * specified vector. If the largest value is
1903         * not unique, the lowest index is returned.
1904         * An exception is thrown if the vector has zero length.
1905         * 
1906         * @param a a vector
1907         * @return the index of the largest value
1908         */
1909        public static int idxMax(float[] a) {
1910                if (a.length == 0)
1911                        throw new ZeroLengthVectorException();
1912                float maxval = a[0];
1913                int maxidx = 0;
1914                for (int i = 1; i < a.length; i++) {
1915                        if (a[i] > maxval) {
1916                                maxval = a[i];
1917                                maxidx = i;
1918                        }
1919                }
1920                return maxidx;
1921        }
1922        
1923        
1924        /**
1925         * Returns the smallest value in the
1926         * specified vector. 
1927         * An exception is thrown if the vector has zero length.
1928         * @param a a vector
1929         * @return the largest value
1930         */
1931        public static float min(final float[] a) {
1932                if (a.length == 0)
1933                        throw new ZeroLengthVectorException();
1934                float minval = Float.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
1935                for (float val : a) {
1936                        if (val < minval) {
1937                                minval = val;
1938                        }
1939                }
1940                return minval;
1941        }
1942        
1943        /**
1944         * Returns the smallest value in the
1945         * specified vector. 
1946         * An exception is thrown if the vector has zero length.
1947         * @param a a vector
1948         * @return the largest value
1949         */
1950        public static double min(final double[] a) {
1951                if (a.length == 0)
1952                        throw new ZeroLengthVectorException();
1953                double minval = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
1954                for (double val : a) {
1955                        if (val < minval) {
1956                                minval = val;
1957                        }
1958                }
1959                return minval;
1960        }
1961        
1962        /**
1963         * Returns the largest value in the specified {@code double[]} vector. 
1964         * An exception is thrown if the vector has zero length.
1965         * @param a a vector
1966         * @return the largest value
1967         */
1968        public static double max(final double[] a) {
1969                if (a.length == 0)
1970                        throw new ZeroLengthVectorException();
1971                double maxval = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
1972                for (double val : a) {
1973                        if (val > maxval) {
1974                                maxval = val;
1975                        }
1976                }
1977                return maxval;
1978        }
1979
1980        /**
1981         * Returns the largest value in the specified {@code float[]} vector. 
1982         * An exception is thrown if the vector has zero length.
1983         * @param a a vector
1984         * @return the largest value
1985         */
1986        public static float max(final float[] a) {
1987                if (a.length == 0)
1988                        throw new ZeroLengthVectorException();
1989                float maxval = Float.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
1990                for (float val : a) {
1991                        if (val > maxval) {
1992                                maxval = val;
1993                        }
1994                }
1995                return maxval;
1996        }
1997        
1998        /**
1999         * Returns the largest value in the specified {@code double[][]} matrix. 
2000         * @param A a matrix
2001         * @return the largest matrix value
2002         */
2003        public static double max(double[][] A) {
2004                double maxval = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
2005                for (int r = 0; r < A.length; r++) {
2006                        for (double val : A[r]) {
2007                                if (val > maxval) {
2008                                        maxval = val;
2009                                }
2010                        }
2011                }
2012                return maxval;
2013        }
2014        
2015        /**
2016         * Returns the largest value in the specified {@code float[][]} matrix. 
2017         * @param A a matrix
2018         * @return the largest matrix value
2019         */
2020        public static float max(float[][] A) {
2021                float maxval = Float.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
2022                for (int r = 0; r < A.length; r++) {
2023                        for (float val : A[r]) {
2024                                if (val > maxval) {
2025                                        maxval = val;
2026                                }
2027                        }
2028                }
2029                return maxval;
2030        }

2032        // Vector concatenation -----------------------
2033        
2034        /**
2035         * Joins (concatenates) a sequence of vectors into a single vector.
2036         * @param as a sequence of vectors (at least one vector)
2037         * @return a vector containing all elements of the input vectors
2038         */
2039        public static float[] join(float[]... as) {
2040                int n = 0;
2041                for (float[] x : as) {
2042                        n = n + x.length;
2043                }
2044                float[] va = new float[n];
2045                int j = 0;
2046                for (float[] x : as) {
2047                        for (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
2048                                va[j] = x[i];
2049                                j++;
2050                        }
2051                }               
2052                return va;
2053        }
2054
2055        /**
2056         * Joins (concatenates) a sequence of vectors into a single vector.
2057         * @param as a sequence of vectors (at least one vector)
2058         * @return a vector containing all elements of the input vectors
2059         */
2060        public static double[] join(double[]... as) {
2061                int n = 0;
2062                for (double[] x : as) {
2063                        n = n + x.length;
2064                }
2065                double[] va = new double[n];    
2066                int j = 0;
2067                for (double[] x : as) {
2068                        for (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
2069                                va[j] = x[i];
2070                                j++;
2071                        }
2072                }               
2073                return va;
2074        }
2075        
2076        // Vector linear interpolation ---------------------------------
2077        
2078        /**
2079         * Performs linear interpolation between two vectors {@code a} and {@code b}, 
2080         * which must have the same length.
2081         * Returns a new vector {@code c = a + t * (b - a)}.
2082         * @param a first vector (to be interpolated from)
2083         * @param b second vector (to be interpolated to)
2084         * @param t interpolation coefficient, expected to be in [0,1]
2085         * @return the interpolated vector
2086         */
2087        public static float[] lerp(float[] a, float[] b, final float t) {
2088                final float[] c = new float[a.length];
2089                for (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
2090                        c[i] = a[i] + t * (b[i] - a[i]);
2091                }
2092                return c;
2093        }
2094        
2095        /**
2096         * Performs linear interpolation between two vectors {@code a} and {@code b}, 
2097         * which must have the same length.
2098         * Returns a new vector {@code c = a + t * (b - a)}.
2099         * @param a first vector (to be interpolated from)
2100         * @param b second vector (to be interpolated to)
2101         * @param t interpolation coefficient, expected to be in [0,1]
2102         * @return the interpolated vector
2103         */
2104        public static double[] lerp(double[] a, double[] b, final double t) {
2105                final double[] c = new double[a.length];
2106                for (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
2107                        c[i] = a[i] + t * (b[i] - a[i]);
2108                }
2109                return c;
2110        }
2111        
2112        
2113        // Homogeneous coordinates ---------------------------------
2114        
2115        /**
2116         * Converts a Cartesian vector to an equivalent homogeneous
2117         * vector by attaching an additional 1-element.
2118         * The resulting homogeneous vector is one element longer than the 
2119         * specified Cartesian vector.
2120         * See also {@link #toCartesian(double[])}.
2121         * @param ac a Cartesian vector
2122         * @return an equivalent homogeneous vector
2123         */
2124        public static double[] toHomogeneous(double[] ac) {
2125                double[] xh = new double[ac.length + 1];
2126                for (int i = 0; i < ac.length; i++) {
2127                        xh[i] = ac[i];
2128                        xh[xh.length - 1] = 1;
2129                }
2130                return xh;
2131        }
2132        
2133        /**
2134         * Converts a homogeneous vector to its equivalent Cartesian vector, which is
2135         * one element shorter. See also {@link #toHomogeneous(double[])}.
2136         * 
2137         * @param ah a homogeneous vector
2138         * @return the equivalent Cartesian vector
2139         * @throws DivideByZeroException if the last vector element is zero
2140         */
2141        public static double[] toCartesian(double[] ah) throws DivideByZeroException {
2142                double[] xc = new double[ah.length - 1];
2143                final double s = 1 / ah[ah.length - 1];
2144                if (!Double.isFinite(s))        // isZero(s)
2145                        throw new DivideByZeroException();
2146                for (int i = 0; i < ah.length - 1; i++) {
2147                        xc[i] = s * ah[i];
2148                }
2149                return xc;
2150        }
2151        
2152        // Determinants --------------------------------------------
2153        
2154        /**
2155         * Calculates and returns the determinant of the given {@link RealMatrix}.
2156         * Throws an exception if the matrix is non-square.
2157         * 
2158         * @param A a square matrix
2159         * @return the determinant
2160         */
2161        public static double determinant(RealMatrix A) {
2162                if (!A.isSquare())
2163                        throw new NonsquareMatrixException();
2164                return new LUDecomposition(A).getDeterminant();
2165        }
2166        
2167        /**
2168         * Calculates and returns the determinant of the given {@code double[][]}
2169         * matrix. Throws an exception if the matrix is non-square.
2170         * 
2171         * @param A a square matrix
2172         * @return the determinant
2173         */
2174        public static double determinant(final double[][] A) {
2175                return determinant(MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(A));
2176        }
2177
2178        /**
2179         * Calculates and returns the determinant of the given 2x2 {@code double[][]}
2180         * matrix. This method is hard-coded for the specific matrix size for better
2181         * performance than the general method ({@link #determinant(double[][])}).
2182         * Throws an exception if the matrix is not 2x2.
2183         * 
2184         * @param A a 2x2 matrix
2185         * @return the determinant
2186         */
2187        public static double determinant2x2(final double[][] A) {
2188                if (A.length != 2 || A[0].length != 2)
2189                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
2190                return A[0][0] * A[1][1] - A[0][1] * A[1][0];
2191        }
2192        
2193        /**
2194         * Calculates and returns the determinant of the given 2x2 {@code float[][]}
2195         * matrix. Throws an exception if the matrix is not 2x2.
2196         * 
2197         * @param A a 2x2 matrix
2198         * @return the determinant
2199         */
2200        public static float determinant2x2(final float[][] A) {
2201                if (A.length != 2 || A[0].length != 2)
2202                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
2203                return A[0][0] * A[1][1] - A[0][1] * A[1][0];
2204        }
2205        
2206
2207        /**
2208         * Calculates and returns the determinant of the given 3x3 {@code double[][]}
2209         * matrix. This method is hard-coded for the specific matrix size for better
2210         * performance than the general method ({@link #determinant(double[][])}).
2211         * Throws an exception if the matrix is not 3x3.
2212         * 
2213         * @param A a 3x3 matrix
2214         * @return the determinant
2215         */
2216        public static double determinant3x3(final double[][] A) {
2217                if (A.length != 3 || A[0].length != 3)
2218                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
2219                return 
2220                        A[0][0] * A[1][1] * A[2][2] + 
2221                        A[0][1] * A[1][2] * A[2][0]     + 
2222                        A[0][2] * A[1][0] * A[2][1] - 
2223                        A[2][0] * A[1][1] * A[0][2] - 
2224                        A[2][1] * A[1][2] * A[0][0] - 
2225                        A[2][2] * A[1][0] * A[0][1] ;
2226        }
2227        
2228        /**
2229         * Calculates and returns the determinant of the given 3x3 {@code float[][]}
2230         * matrix. Throws an exception if the matrix is not 3x3.
2231         * 
2232         * @param A a 3x3 matrix
2233         * @return the determinant
2234         */
2235        public static float determinant3x3(final float[][] A) {
2236                if (A.length != 3 || A[0].length != 3)
2237                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
2238                return
2239                        A[0][0] * A[1][1] * A[2][2] +
2240                        A[0][1] * A[1][2] * A[2][0] +
2241                        A[0][2] * A[1][0] * A[2][1] -
2242                        A[2][0] * A[1][1] * A[0][2] -
2243                        A[2][1] * A[1][2] * A[0][0] -
2244                        A[2][2] * A[1][0] * A[0][1] ;
2245        }
2246
2247
2248        
2249        // Matrix trace ---------------------------------------
2250        
2251        /**
2252         * Calculates and returns the trace of the given {@code double[][]} matrix.
2253         * Throws an exception if the matrix is non-square.
2254         * 
2255         * @param A a square matrix
2256         * @return the trace
2257         */
2258        public static double trace(final double[][] A) {
2259                final int m = getNumberOfRows(A);
2260                final int n = getNumberOfColumns(A);
2261                if (m != n) 
2262                        throw new NonsquareMatrixException();
2263                double s = 0;
2264                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
2265                                s = s + A[i][i];
2266                }
2267                return s;
2268        }
2269        
2270        /**
2271         * Calculates and returns the trace of the given {@code float[][]} matrix.
2272         * Throws an exception if the matrix is non-square.
2273         * 
2274         * @param A a square matrix
2275         * @return the trace
2276         */
2277        public static float trace(final float[][] A) {
2278                final int m = getNumberOfRows(A);
2279                final int n = getNumberOfColumns(A);
2280                if (m != n) 
2281                        throw new NonsquareMatrixException();
2282                double s = 0;
2283                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
2284                                s = s + A[i][i];
2285                }
2286                return (float) s;
2287        }
2288        
2289        // Matrix transposition ---------------------------------------
2290        
2291        /**
2292         * Returns the transpose of the given {@code double[][]} matrix. The original
2293         * matrix is not modified.
2294         * 
2295         * @param A a matrix
2296         * @return the transpose of the matrix
2297         */
2298        public static double[][] transpose(double[][] A) {
2299                final int m = getNumberOfRows(A);
2300                final int n = getNumberOfColumns(A);
2301                double[][] At = new double[n][m];
2302                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
2303                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
2304                                At[j][i] = A[i][j];
2305                        }
2306                }
2307                return At;
2308        }
2309        
2310        /**
2311         * Returns the transpose of the given {@code float[][]} matrix. The original
2312         * matrix is not modified.
2313         * 
2314         * @param A a matrix
2315         * @return the transpose of the matrix
2316         */
2317        public static float[][] transpose(float[][] A) {
2318                final int m = getNumberOfRows(A);
2319                final int n = getNumberOfColumns(A);
2320                float[][] At = new float[n][m];
2321                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
2322                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
2323                                At[j][i] = A[i][j];
2324                        }
2325                }
2326                return At;
2327        }

2329        
2330        // Checking vectors for all zero values  ------------------------------
2331        
2332        /**
2333         * Checks if all elements of the specified {@code double[]} vector are zero
2334         * using the specified tolerance value.
2335         * 
2336         * @param a         a vector
2337         * @param tolerance the tolerance value
2338         * @return true if all vector elements are smaller than the tolerance
2339         */
2340        public static boolean isZero(double[] a, double tolerance) {
2341                for (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
2342                        if (!Arithmetic.isZero(a[i], tolerance)) {
2343                                return false;
2344                        }
2345                }
2346                return true;
2347        }
2348        
2349        /**
2350         * Checks if all elements of the specified {@code double[]} vector are zero
2351         * using the default tolerance value ({@link Arithmetic#EPSILON_DOUBLE}).
2352         * 
2353         * @param a a vector
2354         * @return true if all vector elements are smaller than the tolerance
2355         */
2356        public static boolean isZero(double[] a) {
2357                return isZero(a, Arithmetic.EPSILON_DOUBLE);
2358        }
2359        
2360        /**
2361         * Checks if all elements of the specified {@code float[]} vector are zero using
2362         * the specified tolerance value.
2363         * 
2364         * @param a         a vector
2365         * @param tolerance the tolerance value
2366         * @return true if all vector elements are smaller than the tolerance
2367         */
2368        public static boolean isZero(float[] a, float tolerance) {
2369                for (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
2370                        if (!Arithmetic.isZero(a[i], tolerance)) {
2371                                return false;
2372                        }
2373                }
2374                return true;
2375        }
2376        
2377        /**
2378         * Checks if all elements of the specified {@code float[]} vector are zero using
2379         * the default tolerance value ({@link Arithmetic#EPSILON_DOUBLE}).
2380         * 
2381         * @param a a vector
2382         * @return true if all vector elements are smaller than the tolerance
2383         */
2384        public static boolean isZero(float[] a) {
2385                return isZero(a, Arithmetic.EPSILON_FLOAT);
2386        }
2387        
2388        // Checking matrices for all zero values  ------------------------------
2389        
2390        /**
2391         * Checks if all elements of the specified {@code double[][]} matrix are zero
2392         * using the specified tolerance value.
2393         * 
2394         * @param A         a matrix
2395         * @param tolerance the tolerance value
2396         * @return true if all matrix elements are smaller than the tolerance
2397         */
2398        public static boolean isZero(double[][] A, double tolerance) {
2399                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) {    // for each matrix row i
2400                        if (!Matrix.isZero(A[i], tolerance)) {
2401                                return false;
2402                        }
2403                }
2404                return true;
2405        }
2406        
2407        /**
2408         * Checks if all elements of the specified {@code double[][]} matrix are zero
2409         * using default tolerance value ({@link Arithmetic#EPSILON_DOUBLE}).
2410         * 
2411         * @param A a matrix
2412         * @return true if all matrix elements are smaller than the tolerance
2413         */
2414        public static boolean isZero(double[][] A) {
2415                return isZero(A, Arithmetic.EPSILON_DOUBLE);
2416        }
2417        
2418        // Sorting vectors (non-destructively)  ------------------------------
2419        
2420        /**
2421         * Returns a sorted copy of the given {@code double[]} vector. Elements are
2422         * sorted by increasing value (smallest first).
2423         * 
2424         * @param a a {@code double[]} vector
2425         * @return a sorted copy of the vector
2426         */
2427        public static double[] sort(double[] a) {
2428                double[] y = Arrays.copyOf(a, a.length);
2429                Arrays.sort(y);
2430                return y;
2431        }
2432        
2433        /**
2434         * Returns a sorted copy of the given {@code float[]} vector. Elements are
2435         * sorted by increasing value (smallest first).
2436         * 
2437         * @param a a {@code float[]} vector
2438         * @return a sorted copy of the vector
2439         */
2440        public static float[] sort(float[] a) {
2441                float[] y = Arrays.copyOf(a, a.length);
2442                Arrays.sort(y);
2443                return y;
2444        }
2445        
2446        // Matrix inversion ---------------------------------------
2447        
2448        /**
2449         * Calculates and returns the inverse of the given matrix, which must be square.
2450         * Exceptions are thrown if the supplied matrix is not square or ill-conditioned
2451         * (singular).
2452         * 
2453         * @param A a square matrix
2454         * @return the inverse matrix
2455         * @throws NonsquareMatrixException if the supplied matrix is not square
2456         */
2457        public static double[][] inverse(final double[][] A) throws NonsquareMatrixException {
2458                if (!isSquare(A))
2459                        throw new NonsquareMatrixException();
2460                RealMatrix M = MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(A);
2461                return MatrixUtils.inverse(M).getData();
2462        }
2463        
2464        /**
2465         * Calculates and returns the inverse of the given matrix, which must be square.
2466         * Exceptions are thrown if the supplied matrix is not square or ill-conditioned
2467         * (singular).
2468         * 
2469         * @param A a square matrix
2470         * @return the inverse matrix
2471         * @throws NonsquareMatrixException if the supplied matrix is not square
2472         */
2473        public static float[][] inverse(final float[][] A) throws NonsquareMatrixException {
2474                if (!isSquare(A))
2475                        throw new NonsquareMatrixException();
2476                double[][] Ad = toDouble(A);
2477                return toFloat(inverse(Ad));
2478        }
2479
2480        // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
2481        
2482        /**
2483         * Finds the exact solution x for the linear system of equations A * x = b.
2484         * Returns the solution vector x or {@code null} if the supplied matrix is
2485         * ill-conditioned (i.e., singular). Exceptions are thrown if A is not square or
2486         * dimensions are incompatible. Calls {@link #solve(RealMatrix, RealVector)}.
2487         * 
2488         * @param A a square matrix of size n x n
2489         * @param b a vector of length n
2490         * @return the solution vector (x) of length n or {@code null} if no solution
2491         *         possible
2492         */
2493        public static double[] solve(final double[][] A, double[] b) {
2494                RealVector x = solve(MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(A), MatrixUtils.createRealVector(b));
2495                return (x == null) ? null : x.toArray();
2496        }
2497        
2498        /**
2499         * Finds the exact solution x for the linear system of equations A * x = b.
2500         * Returns the solution vector x or {@code null} if the supplied matrix is
2501         * ill-conditioned (i.e., singular). Exceptions are thrown if A is not square or
2502         * dimensions are incompatible. Uses {@link LUDecomposition} from the Apache
2503         * Commons Math library.
2504         * 
2505         * @param A a square matrix of size n x n
2506         * @param b a vector of length n
2507         * @return the solution vector (x) of length n or {@code null} if no solution
2508         *         possible
2509         */
2510        public static RealVector solve(RealMatrix A, RealVector b) {
2511                if (!A.isSquare()) {
2512                        throw new NonsquareMatrixException();
2513                }
2514                if (A.getRowDimension() != b.getDimension()) {
2515                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
2516                }
2517//              DecompositionSolver solver = new LUDecomposition(A, 0.0).getSolver();
2518                DecompositionSolver solver = new LUDecomposition(A).getSolver();
2519                RealVector x = null;
2520                try {
2521                        x = solver.solve(b);
2522                } catch (SingularMatrixException e) {}
2523                return x;
2524        }
2525        
2526        // Output to strings and streams ------------------------------------------
2527        
2528        /**
2529         * Returns a string representation of the specified vector.
2530         * @param a a vector
2531         * @return the string representation
2532         */
2533        public static String toString(double[] a) {
2534                if (a == null) {
2535                        return String.valueOf(a);
2536                }
2537                ByteArrayOutputStream bas = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
2538                PrintStream strm = new PrintStream(bas);
2539                printToStream(a, strm);
2540                return bas.toString();
2541        }
2542

2544         * Returns a string representation of the specified vector.
2545         * @param a a vector
2546         * @return the string representation
2547         */
2548        public static String toString(float[] a) {
2549                if (a == null) {
2550                        return String.valueOf(a);
2551                }
2552                ByteArrayOutputStream bas = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
2553                PrintStream strm = new PrintStream(bas);
2554                printToStream(a, strm);
2555                return bas.toString();
2556        }
2557        
2558        /**
2559         * Returns a string representation of the specified vector.
2560         * @param a a vector
2561         * @return the string representation
2562         */
2563        public static String toString(RealVector a) {
2564                if (a == null) {
2565                        return String.valueOf(a);
2566                }
2567                else {
2568                        return toString(a.toArray());
2569                }
2570        }

2577        public static String toString(double[][] A) {
2578                if (A == null) {
2579                        return String.valueOf(A);
2580                }
2581                ByteArrayOutputStream bas = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
2582                PrintStream strm = new PrintStream(bas);
2583                printToStream(A, strm);
2584                return bas.toString();
2585        }

2594                        return String.valueOf(A);
2595                }
2596                ByteArrayOutputStream bas = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
2597                PrintStream strm = new PrintStream(bas);

2599                return bas.toString();
2600        }

2623        public static String toString(RealMatrix A) {

2632        // --------------------
2633        
2634        /**
2635         * Outputs a string representation of the given vector to
2636         * the specified output stream.
2637         * @param a the vector
2638         * @param strm the output stream
2639         * @see #toString(double[])
2640         */
2641        public static void printToStream(double[] a, PrintStream strm) {
2642                String fStr = PrintPrecision.getFormatStringFloat();
2643                strm.format("%c", LeftDelimitChar);
2644                for (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
2645                        if (i > 0)
2646                                strm.format("%c ", SeparationChar);
2647                        strm.format(PrintLocale, fStr, a[i]);
2648                }
2649                strm.format("%c", RightDelimitChar);
2650                strm.flush();
2651        }
2652        
2653        /**
2654         * Outputs a string representation of the given matrix to
2655         * the specified output stream.
2656         * @param A the matrix
2657         * @param strm the output stream
2658         * @see #toString(double[][])
2659         */
2660        public static void printToStream(double[][] A, PrintStream strm) {
2661                String fStr = PrintPrecision.getFormatStringFloat();
2662                strm.format("%c", LeftDelimitChar);
2663                for (int i=0; i< A.length; i++) {
2664                        if (i == 0)
2665                                strm.format("%c", LeftDelimitChar);
2666                        else
2667                                strm.format("%c \n%c", SeparationChar, LeftDelimitChar);
2668                        for (int j=0; j< A[i].length; j++) {
2669                                if (j == 0) 
2670                                        strm.format(PrintLocale, fStr, A[i][j]);
2671                                else
2672                                        strm.format(PrintLocale, "%c " + fStr, SeparationChar, A[i][j]);
2673                        }
2674                        strm.format("%c", RightDelimitChar);
2675                }
2676                strm.format("%c", RightDelimitChar);
2677                strm.flush();
2678        }
2679        
2680        /**
2681         * Outputs a string representation of the given vector to
2682         * the specified output stream.
2683         * @param a the vector
2684         * @param strm the output stream
2685         * @see #toString(float[])
2686         */
2687        public static void printToStream(float[] a, PrintStream strm) {
2688                String fStr = PrintPrecision.getFormatStringFloat();
2689                strm.format("%c", LeftDelimitChar);
2690                for (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
2691                        if (i > 0)
2692                                strm.format("%c ", SeparationChar);
2693                        strm.format(PrintLocale, fStr, a[i]);
2694                }
2695                strm.format("%c", RightDelimitChar);
2696                strm.flush();
2697        }
2698        
2699        /**
2700         * Outputs a string representation of the given matrix to
2701         * the specified output stream.
2702         * @param A the matrix
2703         * @param strm the output stream
2704         * @see #toString(float[][])
2705         */
2706        public static void printToStream(float[][] A, PrintStream strm) {
2707                String fStr = PrintPrecision.getFormatStringFloat();
2708                strm.format("%c", LeftDelimitChar);
2709                for (int i=0; i< A.length; i++) {
2710                        if (i == 0)
2711                                strm.format("%c", LeftDelimitChar);
2712                        else
2713                                strm.format("%c \n%c", SeparationChar, LeftDelimitChar);
2714                        for (int j = 0; j < A[i].length; j++) {
2715                                if (j == 0) 
2716                                        strm.format(PrintLocale, fStr, A[i][j]);
2717                                else
2718                                        strm.format(PrintLocale, "%c " + fStr, SeparationChar, A[i][j]);
2719                        }
2720                        strm.format("%c", RightDelimitChar);
2721                }
2722                strm.format("%c", RightDelimitChar);
2723                strm.flush();
2724        }
2725        
2726        // --------------------------------------------------------------------------
2727        
2728        public static void printToStream(long[][] A, PrintStream strm) {
2729                strm.format("%c", LeftDelimitChar);
2730                for (int i=0; i< A.length; i++) {
2731                        if (i == 0)
2732                                strm.format("%c", LeftDelimitChar);
2733                        else
2734                                strm.format("%c \n%c", SeparationChar, LeftDelimitChar);
2735                        for (int j=0; j< A[i].length; j++) {
2736                                if (j == 0) 
2737                                        strm.format(PrintLocale, "%dL", A[i][j]);
2738                                else
2739                                        strm.format(PrintLocale, "%c %dL", SeparationChar, A[i][j]);
2740                        }
2741                        strm.format("%c", RightDelimitChar);
2742                }
2743                strm.format("%c", RightDelimitChar);
2744                strm.flush();
2745        }
2746
2747        // Exceptions ----------------------------------------------------------------
2748        
2749        /** Thrown when the dimensions of matrix/vector arguments do not match. */
2750        public static class IncompatibleDimensionsException extends RuntimeException {          
2751                public IncompatibleDimensionsException() {
2752                        super("incompatible matrix-vector dimensions");
2753                }
2754                public IncompatibleDimensionsException(String msg) {
2755                        super(msg);
2756                }
2757        }
2758        
2759        /** Thrown when a non-square matrix is encountered where a square matrix is assumed. */
2760        public static class NonsquareMatrixException extends RuntimeException {
2761                public NonsquareMatrixException() {
2762                        super("square matrix expected");
2763                }
2764                public NonsquareMatrixException(String msg) {
2765                        super(msg);
2766                }
2767        }
2768        
2769        /** Thrown when source and target objects are identical but shouldn't. */
2770        public static class SameSourceTargetException extends RuntimeException {
2771                public SameSourceTargetException() {
2772                        super("source and target must not be the same");
2773                }
2774                public SameSourceTargetException(String msg) {
2775                        super(msg);
2776                }
2777        }
2778        
2779        /** Thrown when the length of some vector is zero. */
2780        public static class ZeroLengthVectorException extends RuntimeException {        
2781                public ZeroLengthVectorException() {
2782                        super("vector length must be at least 1");
2783                }
2784                public ZeroLengthVectorException(String msg) {
2785                        super(msg);
2786                }
2787        }
2788        
2789        // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
2790        
2791        public static void main(String[] args) {
2792                double s = Double.NaN;
2793                s = -1.0 / 1E-200; // / 1E-200;
2794                System.out.println(Double.isFinite(s));
2795                System.out.println((double[]) null);
2796                
2797                double[][] A = makeDoubleMatrix(5, 4,
2798                                -1,2,3,4,
2799                                5,6,7,8,
2800                                9,10,11,12,
2801                                13,14,15,16,
2802                                17,18,19, Double.NaN);
2803                System.out.println("A = \n" + toString(A));
2804                
2805//              RealMatrix B = makeRealMatrix(5, 4);
2806//              System.out.println("B = \n" + toString(B.getData()));
2807                
2808                long[][] AL = Matrix.toLongBits(A);
2809                System.out.println("AL = \n" + toString(AL));
2810                
2811                double[][] A2 = Matrix.fromLongBits(AL);
2812                System.out.println("A2 = \n" + toString(A2));
2813                
2814                double[][] A3 = Matrix.fromLongBits(new long[][]
2815                                {{-4616189618054758400L, 4611686018427387904L, 4613937818241073152L, 4616189618054758400L}, 
2816                                 {4617315517961601024L, 4618441417868443648L, 4619567317775286272L, 4620693217682128896L}, 
2817                                 {4621256167635550208L, 4621819117588971520L, 4622382067542392832L, 4622945017495814144L}, 
2818                                 {4623507967449235456L, 4624070917402656768L, 4624633867356078080L, 4625196817309499392L}, 
2819                                 {4625478292286210048L, 4625759767262920704L, 4626041242239631360L, 9221120237041090560L}});
2820                
2821                System.out.println("A3 = \n" + toString(A3));
2822                
2823        }
